page.title: 02Rocester Village.
page.content: Rocester is a parish and village in the Churnet valley.It's of Roman origin and began as a small fort on the site of the church.An Augustinian.Abbey built in 1146,is marked by an open area known as Abbey Fields,they and the Roman settlement area are listed as an ancient monument.A Roman dig is being carried out by archaeologists sifting the earth to find more remains telling us about the past of Rocester.They are to be placed in an old church building which will become a museum.In 1781-2 Richard Arkwright, pioneer of water powered machinery built a mill at the east end of the village.It is a brick building still in use today.On the side of the shops there's a mural of a Roman Legionary Standard,a crowned letter M and weaver's shuttle to show Rocester's early origins.
